bug.author: ohsewon
bug.summary: [CI/apptest] Python apptest can't find nnstreamer plugin.
bug.description: In CI server, Apptest error message is below. ** Message: start app.. ** Message: finished to load labels, total 1001 Traceback (most recent call last): File "nnstreamer_example_filter.py", line 241, in <module> example.run_example() File "nnstreamer_example_filter.py", line 75, in run_example 'tensor_filter framework=tensorflow-lite model=' + self.tflite_model + ' ! ' GLib.Error: gst_parse_error: no element "tensor_filter" (1) C tests have no problem. Only python test can't find 'tensor_filter' plugin. Python packages are already installed. run command: python nnstreaemr_example_filter.py Can I get a hint about them?

comments.comment: : Thank you for posting issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues/658>#658</denchmark-link> . The person in charge will reply soon.
Please describe the path (pwd) of your execution and other environments (executions from git clone to where you get the error.)
Anyway, I think you need to do $ export GST_PLUGIN_PATH=${the_location_where_you_have_libnnstreamer.so} before running the python script. And if you did't set the variable, this is not a bug. :)
I don't change anything, but it is working well today.. Done..
